title: 🚫 Avoid Suspicious Links
text: Never click unknown or shortened links in emails, SMS, or social media DMs. They could be phishing attempts.

title: 🔒 Use Strong, Unique Passwords
text: Create a different strong password for each account. Use a password manager to store them securely.

title: 🔑 Enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
text: Turn on 2FA for all important accounts (bank, email, social). It adds an extra layer of protection beyond just a password.

title: 📵 Silence Unknown Callers
text: Enable 'Silence Unknown Callers' on your phone to avoid vishing calls pretending to be banks or government bodies.

title: 🧾 Avoid Clicking on Bank SMS Links
text: Phishing SMS pretending to be cashback or bank alerts are common. Visit bank websites/apps directly instead of clicking SMS links.

title: 🔌 Avoid Public USB Charging Ports
text: Using public USB ports can expose your phone to 'juice jacking' attacks. Always use your own power adapter.

title: 🧼 Clear Browser Data Weekly
text: Delete cookies, cache, and browsing history weekly to remove tracking and prevent session hijacking.

title: 🕵️ Use Incognito on Shared Devices
text: When using public or borrowed devices, always use Incognito/Private mode and never save your credentials.

title: 🛑 Don't Share Screen with Strangers
text: Scammers may ask you to share your screen for 'support' or 'refunds'. They can steal OTPs or passwords this way.

title: 📶 Turn Off Bluetooth When Not Needed
text: Bluetooth can be used to access your files without your knowledge. Turn it off when you're not using it.

title: 🧠 Educate Your Family
text: Talk to your parents, siblings, or grandparents about online scams like fake job offers, lotteries, or bank frauds.

title: 🔄 Enable Auto-Updates
text: Keep your apps and OS updated to fix security bugs. Most cyber attacks exploit outdated software.

title: 🔍 Google Yourself Occasionally
text: Search your name, email, and phone to see what’s publicly visible. Remove sensitive results where possible.
